abstract: What could a son say about marriage to a father who had divorced twice, seeming to treat love as though it were seasonal?
lead_paragraph: My father was married twice before I was born, once to a woman I met much later and once to my mother. When he asked me to speak in August at the reception of his third wedding, I believed it something I was incapable of doing: What could a son say about marriage to a father who had divorced twice, seeming to treat love as though it were seasonal?
